title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2206.2 - Injunctions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2206.2 - Injunctions

State Regulations

The administrator may, whenever in his judgment any
person has engaged in or is about to engage in acts or practices which
constitute or will constitute a violation of any provision of section Y51-10.0
of the Rent Law, apply to the Supreme Court for an order (a) enjoining such
acts or practices, (b) enforcing compliance with such provision of said section
or with an order issued by the administrator, or (c) directing the landlord to
correct such violation of such provision; and upon sufficient showing, the

Supreme Court may issue a temporary or permanent injunction, restraining order
or other order, all of which shall be granted without bond. Jurisdiction shall
not be deemed lacking in the Supreme Court because a defense is based upon
order of an inferior court. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2206.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
